Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 08:19PM mccordka wrote: Thank you raincitygirl. The simulation went very well and the radiation oncology nurse allayed my fears. I learned that the effect on my skin was likely to be mild. The radiation oncologist favors lanolin and corn starch beginning with the first treatment. Foliculitis, if it develops, can be easily treated with a hydrocortisone cream. So onward!
